title: Finding the Slope of the Perpendicular Line
text: We know that a perpendicular line must have a slope that is the negative reciprocal of the original line's slope. The negative reciprocal of the original slope, $$3$$, is $$\frac{-1}{3}$$.

title: Solving for $$b$$
text: Since we know that the line passes through the point $$(3,0)$$, we can create the equation $$0=-1+b$$. From this, we get $$b=1$$. So, $$y=\left(-\frac{1}{3}\right) x+1$$
